title: Reduce verbosity of logging on VC when a BN is offline
body:
## Description

When I set two beacon nodes for redundancy, it seems that lighthouse is trying the first node twice instead of trying both. In case the first one is not synced, it does not fall back to the second one.

## Version

 v1.5.1-b0ac346

Building from stable

## Present Behaviour


I have set up my validator with two beacon nodes for redundancy:

- my local Lighthouse beacon chain
- an ETH2 Infura endpoint

The first one is out of sync, so I hoped that it will fall back to the Infura endpoint while the first one catches up. 
But the validator is saying that the beacon node is not synced, and it says it **twice**. If I configure only one (infura) it works correctly. There is no output of trying to connect with the second beacon node.

```
Sep 04 16:42:29.000 INFO Connected to beacon node(s)             synced: 1, available: 2, total: 2, service: notifier
Sep 04 16:42:29.001 INFO All validators active                   slot: 1996710, epoch: 62397, total_validators: 1, active_validators: 1, proposers: 0, service: notifier
Sep 04 16:42:34.001 INFO Connected to beacon node                endpoint: http://localhost:5052/, version: Lighthouse/v1.5.1-b0ac346/x86_64-linux
Sep 04 16:42:34.002 WARN Beacon node is not synced               endpoint: http://localhost:5052/, head_slot: 96128, sync_distance: 1900582
Sep 04 16:42:35.004 INFO Connected to beacon node                endpoint: http://localhost:5052/, version: Lighthouse/v1.5.1-b0ac346/x86_64-linux
Sep 04 16:42:35.004 WARN Beacon node is not synced               endpoint: http://localhost:5052/, head_slot: 96192, sync_distance: 1900519
```

It seems as if it is trying the first beacon node twice, instead of trying both beacon nodes.

## Expected Behaviour

It should try the second beacon node. 
It should say that the first one is out of sync only once.
It should show output that it connected to the second node as well.

Did the VC fail to perform duties via the Infura node all together?

The fallback behaviour is fairly well tested, so I'd be surprised if it's failing to use the fallback at all.

The VC will periodically check the first node and keep logging warnings when it is not online/synced. So, it's expected behaviour to see sustained, multiple warnings for the first beacon node if it's offline.

Oh, I can see in the first log that there is one BN synced. This would be the Infura node and I expect the VC would have used that.

I'm not convinced we should only log warnings once for the offline node. I think it's important to be loud that the first node is down.

Perhaps the solution here is to provide some log that although one node is offline, there is one that is online.

Ah, thanks! I couldn't understand the log that it meant that one is connected.
And I didn't mean only once in the whole log, I meant that `Offline beacon node` appears repeated every time. And it does feel excessive amount of logging, like it swamps all other logs. I would like to see so many errors if there were no active beacon nodes.

OMG! I just realized I was using the wrong port for the localhost beacon node, I set the eth1 port number 8545 so I was getting a 405 error. Still, I think everything still applies. In this case the node was not offline, but giving error.

Actually, here is the line when the beacon node is offline. 

```
WARN Offline beacon node                     endpoint: http://127.0.0.1:5052/, error: Reqwest(reqwest::Error { kind: Request, url: Url { scheme: "http", cannot_be_a_base: false, username: "", password: None, host: Some(Ipv4(127.0.0.1)), port: Some(5052), path: "/eth/v1/node/version", query: None, fragment: None }, source: hyper::Error(Connect, ConnectError("tcp connect error", Os { code: 111, kind: ConnectionRefused, message: "Connection refused" })) })
```

2 things:

-  there is a typo: `Reqwest`
- The line is super long. It can be summarized to something like `WARN Offline beacon node                     endpoint: http://127.0.0.1:5052/ connection refused`

> there is a typo: Reqwest

[`reqwest`](https://docs.rs/reqwest/0.11.4/reqwest/index.html) is a rust library.

> The line is super long. It can be summarized to something

This is just the default formatting of the error from reqwest. I'm not sure we want to go down the path of summarizing all the possible errors it gives at this point.

Ok then, reducing verbosity in the number of lines logged would still be an improvement.
